snippet: A prosecutor says the police knew that violence was likely and still let in armed men without a search, then stood by and watched as they attacked.
abstract: Egypt’s general prosecutor charges 75 people, including the top police official in Port Said, Egypt, in connection with a February 2012 soccer riot in the city where at least 74 people were killed.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and MAYY El SHEIKH

lead_paragraph: A prosecutor says the police knew that violence was likely and still let in armed men without a search, then stood by and watched as they attacked.

headline.seo: 75 Charged in Deaths at Soccer Riot in Egypt
headline.main: 75 Charged in Deaths at Soccer Riot in Egypt
headline.print_headline: 75 Charged In Deaths At Soccer Riot In Egypt
